intro: Alsine pallida, commonly known as pale alsike, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia and North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its small, white to pinkish flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a distinctive, delicate appearance.
